page.title: 01BELLERBY AND DISTRICT
page.content: Known as Belgebi in the original Domesday survey, Bellerby is situated on the A6108 2 miles from Leyburn and 9 miles from Richmond.The surrounding area is mainly agricultural. The land to the north and north west of the village is mainly moorland or rough grassland and the greater part of it is used by the Ministry of Defence as firing ranges and local farmers for the grazing of sheep. The village has a population of about 300 and supports an Anglican church, a Methodist chapel, a pub, a shop, a post office, a village hall and a tea shop. The village school closed on July 19th. 1985. There is no large single employer at all in this area. The greatest number of people work on the land or have jobs in nearby Leyburn. Tourism is quite important.
